name: Sauerkraut on Bread Dough
author: Catrin
summary: This German appetizer goes really well with a crisp Riesling or German beer!
ingredients: 1 cup bacon, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
directions: Crumble the yeast into a small bowl
Pour in the sugar and water, and stir with a fork until the yeast has dissolved
Allow to sit for 15 minutes, then stir in the salt and clarified butter
Pour the flour into a large bowl and make a well in the center
Stir in the yeast mixture, then knead until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 12 minutes
Return dough to the bowl, cover with a cloth, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour
While dough is rising, cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until nearly crispy; drain off fat
Mix together the sour cream, eggs, caraway seed, nutmeg, salt, and pepper in a bowl until smooth
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Roll out the dough into a rectangle to fit a baking sheet
Place the dough onto the baking sheet and sprinkle with bacon
Evenly cover the dough with well drained sauerkraut, then drizzle the sour cream and egg mixture over the sauerkraut
Bake on the middle rack of the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until bread is browned on the top and underneath
Let cool slightly, then cut into squares to serve
